settings.blog-title: 7 STEPS TO A WINTER CAPSULE WARDROBE

settings.text: Winter must-haves or cold-weather staples... Every wardrobe needs reliable pieces that will last for years, feel good with every wear - and look even better. With short days and unpredictable weather upon us, now is the time to consider refining your seasonal edit. Here are our seven steps to creating a winter capsule wardrobe filled with the pieces that promise to stylishly see you through the colder months.

settings.grid-content:
1. Luxe tracksuits

Unsurprisingly, the last year has seen comfort leap up our list of priorities. While tracksuits were once deemed appropriate for the gym only, luxe iterations won’t let your impeccable dress sense slip. A long-time Chinti & Parker failsafe, in our eyes the cashmere tracksuit holds a place in every well-edited rotation.

No longer confined to evenings and weekends; whether a return to the office is on the horizon or the kitchen table is your new workspace, a pair of our camel cashmere wide-leg pants can easily be elevated for business meetings. Pair yours with a white tee, the coordinating sweater and plenty of stacked gold jewellery.

2. A classic coat

You can’t afford to skimp on outerwear in winter, meaning a classic coat is an investment of the highest order. Choose well here and you’ll have a piece that you will reach for season after season. Whether you’re gravitating towards a plush wool style or a masculine trench, your new perennial favourite should adapt as trends come and go.

3. Cashmere sweaters

When the cold weather hits, we instantly reach for our staple knits, and what could be more luxurious than a cashmere jumper We love neutral hues for fuss-free dressing on dark mornings - you can’t go wrong with oatmeal or beige. These versatile pieces offer the perfect foundation to your winter capsule wardrobe. Opt for an array of shapes and fits to keep things interesting; a roll neck adds an extra layer of protection against the elements, while a V-neck allows eye-catching accessories to be showcased.

4. Your favourite jeans

Once upon a time, skinny jeans were the beating heart of a closest. Denim is a strong and easy default for both relaxed and dressed-up occasions, but nowadays we tend to prefer high-rise, straight-leg, and vintage-inspired styles. Pair yours with a T-shirt and favourite cashmere sweaterand you really can’t go wrong.

5. Boots

Strappy sandals are safely tucked away until next summer, and in their place are our favourite boots. There’s no denying just how versatile boots can be - from ankle to knee-high, and chunky to delicate heels - there’s a silhouette to suit your every need. Ankle boots offer the perfect casual pairing for cropped, straight-leg jeans, while a slouchier, knee-high style balances a slimline skirt and chunky knit.

6. Cardigans to layer

Cardigans are a year-round essential, and deserve a permanent place in your winter rotation. Ideal for throwing on for the school run, or layering over tailored trousers for an office-friendly outfit, they’re as versatile as they are stylish. Refine your look by cinching the waist with a belt.

7. The finishing touches

When the temperature looks set to drop below freezing, staying warm is top of our agenda. We know the benefits of a good winter coat, but the right accessories will go that extra mile in keeping you snug and stylish in even the most unforgiving of weather. Our luxurious cashmere hats, in our signature beanie style, paired with the coordinating cashmere scarf will become true cold-snap companions.
